info.name: CAA Record
author: pdteam
info.description: A CAA record was discovered. A CAA record is used to specify which certificate authorities (CAs) are allowed to issue certificates for a domain.

request:
;; opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 62351
;; flags: rd; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version 0; flags:; udp: 4096

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.cli-civaux.fr.	IN	 CAA
response:
;; opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 62351
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version 0; flags:; udp: 512

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.cli-civaux.fr.	IN	 CAA

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
cli-civaux.fr.	1800	IN	SOA	ns1.gandi.net. hostmaster.gandi.net. 1712793600 10800 3600 604800 10800

author: dwisiswant0
lu4nx
info.description: A web application firewall was detected.

request:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.cli-civaux.fr
User-Agent: Nuclei - Open-source project (github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei)
Connection: close
Content-Length: 27
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Accept-Encoding: gzip

_=<script>alert(1)</script>
response:
HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden Connection: close Transfer-Encoding: chunked Content-Type: text/html Date: Mon, 15 Apr 2024 10:18:13 GMT Server: nginx Vary: Accept-Encoding 403 Forbidden

403 Forbidden

nginx

info.name: SMTP Service Detection
author: pussycat0x
info.description: SMTP is part of the application layer of the TCP/IP protocol. Using a process called “store and forward,” SMTP moves your email on and across networks.

response:
220 dpt86-web-02.oxyd.net ESMTP Postfix (Debian/GNU)
500 5.5.2 Error: bad syntax

info.name: STARTTLS Mail Server Detection
author: r3dg33k
info.description: STARTTLS is an email protocol command that tells an email server that an email client, including an email client running in a web browser, wants to turn an existing insecure connection into a secure one.

response:
220 dpt86-web-02.oxyd.net ESMTP Postfix (Debian/GNU)
250-dpt86-web-02.oxyd.net
250-PIPELINING
250-SIZE 10240000
250-ETRN
250-STARTTLS
250-AUTH DIGEST-MD5 CRAM-MD5 PLAIN LOGIN
250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES
250-8BITMIME
250 DSN

info.name: Detect SSL Certificate Issuer
author: lingtren
info.description: Extract the issuer's organization from the target's certificate. Issuers are entities which sign and distribute certificates.

info.name: SSL DNS Names
author: pdteam
info.description: Extract the Subject Alternative Name (SAN) from the target's certificate. SAN facilitates the usage of additional hostnames with the same certificate.

info.name: TLS Version - Detect
author: pdteam
pussycat0x
info.description:
TLS version detection is a security process used to determine the version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol used by a computer or server.
It is important to detect the TLS version in order to ensure secure communication between two computers or servers.
